doc.field: Sandi L. Wisenberg, journalist and author, was a features writer for the Miami Herald, for which she wrote "Reds: A Generation of American Radicals Fads Away on Miami Beach" (July, 21, 1985). The collection contains Wisenberg's reseach files for "Reds: A Generation of Radicals Fades Away on Miami Beach," including files labeled with the first names of the individuals featured. The files include including notebooks, drafts, clippings and other printed ephemera, and a dozen audiocassettes, principally interviews with the subjects of her article.

Sandi L. Wisenberg, journalist and author, was a features writer for the Miami Herald, for which she wrote "Reds: A Generation of American Radicals Fads Away on Miami Beach" (July, 21, 1985). The collection contains Wisenberg's reseach files for "Reds: A Generation of Radicals Fades Away on Miami Beach," including files labeled with the first names of the individuals featured. The files include including notebooks, drafts, clippings and other printed ephemera, and a dozen audiocassettes, principally interviews with the subjects of her article.

The collection contains Wisenberg's reseach files for "Reds: A Generation of Radicals Fades Away on Miami Beach," including files labeled with the first names of the individuals featured. The files include notebooks, drafts, clippings and other printed ephemera. There are also a dozen audiocassettes, principally interviews with the subjects of her article.

Sandi L. Wisenberg, journalist and author, was a features writer for the Miami Herald, for which she wrote "Reds: A Generation of American Radicals Fades Away on Miami Beach" (July, 21, 1985). Wisenberg also wrote Holocaust Girls: History, Memory and Other Obsessions (2002), and The Adventures of Cancer Bitch (2009). For more biographical information, see her website (http://slwisenberg.blogspot.com/).

Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
